text: Rio is a city transformed by the Olympic
Games billions have been spent on
investment in new sports venues museums
and public transport but critics say
it's money that should have gone to
other more important priorities if
cities want to prioritize the needs of
their citizens basic education basic
safety access to water access to food
transportation Park space etc things
that make a good life the Olympics is
clearly not part of that anymore what
the Olympics are about is winners and
losers few have lost as much as local
residents like Dona Maria de Pena I've
got another new book out they had a
thought there's nothing left here now
she says gazing through a fence to a
corporate car park where the homes of
almost 600 families used to be
she was bloodied in the battle to save
the favela next to the Olympic Park but
deemed an intolerable I saw for this
global mega event and bulldoze to the
ground putting on this showpiece has
almost bankrupted the local government
the impact can be seen and smelled
everywhere cleaning up its chronically
polluted waters was another key promise
that Rio made when it was chosen to host
the games but it's a pledge that simply
hasn't been kept guanabara bay is full
of solid waste sewage and chemical
pollution
a commitment to treat 80% of the sewage
entering this Bay has long since been
abandoned the very waters where Olympic
Sailing events are taking place but
officials say there will be a legacy and
spending is tight the games in Brazil it
represents in Rio represents a new model
for the games a model of games that are
more lean with costs reduced costs under
control we spend less public money to do
20 venues then London has spent to do
one venue these games will be unique
because Rio is a unique city rich and
poor living cheek by jowl but not all
reaping the same benefit from hosting
the games what a Davis BBC News Rio
